member.name: M:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CreateOffscreenBrowser(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Create the underlying Browser instance, can be overriden to defer control creation The browser will only be created when size > Size(0,0). If you specify a positive size then the browser will be created, if the ActualWidth and ActualHeight properties are in reality still 0 then you'll likely end up with a browser that won't render.
member.param: size of the current control, must be greater than Size(0, 0)
member.returns: bool to indicate if browser was created. If the browser has already been created then this will return false.

member.summary: Reset the browser's zoom level to default.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.RegisterJsObject(System.String,System.Object,CefSharp.BindingOptions)
member.summary: Registers a Javascript object in this specific browser instance.
member.param: The name of the object. (e.g. "foo", if you want the object to be accessible as window.foo).
The object to be made accessible to Javascript.
binding options - camelCaseJavascriptNames default to true
member.exception: Browser is already initialized. RegisterJsObject must be + called before the underlying CEF browser is created.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.RegisterAsyncJsObject(System.String,System.Object,CefSharp.BindingOptions)

summary.para: Asynchronously registers a Javascript object in this specific browser instance.
Only methods of the object will be availabe.

member.param: The name of the object. (e.g. "foo", if you want the object to be accessible as window.foo).
The object to be made accessible to Javascript.
binding options - camelCaseJavascriptNames default to true
member.exception: Browser is already initialized. RegisterJsObject must be + called before the underlying CEF browser is created.
member.remarks: The registered methods can only be called in an async way, they will all return immeditaly and the resulting object will be a standard javascript Promise object which is usable to wait for completion or failure.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: Event handler for receiving Javascript console messages being sent from web pages. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when your running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.StatusMessage
member.summary: Event handler for changes to the status message. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when your running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadStart
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser begins loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method may not be called for a particular frame if the load request for that frame fails. For notification of overall browser load status use OnLoadingStateChange instead. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.
member.remarks: Whilst this may seem like a logical place to execute js, it's called before the DOM has been loaded, implement as it's called when the underlying V8Context is created (Only called for the main frame at this stage)

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadEnd
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser is done loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method will always be called for all frames irrespective of whether the request completes successfully. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadError
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the resource load for a navigation fails or is canceled. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadingStateChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the Loading state has changed. This event will be fired twice. Once when loading is initiated either programmatically or by user action, and once when loading is terminated due to completion, cancellation of failure. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.Rendering
member.summary: Raised before each render cycle, and allows you to adjust the bitmap before it's rendered/applied

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanExecuteJavascriptInMainFrame
member.summary: A flag that indicates if you can execute javascript in the main frame. Flag is set to true in IRenderProcessMessageHandler.OnContextCreated. and false in IRenderProcessMessageHandler.OnContextReleased

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CefSharp#Internals#IWebBrowserInternal#HasParent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance has parent.
member.value: true if this instance has parent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoBack
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control current supports the GoBack action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go back; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoForward
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the GoForward action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go forward; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.Address
member.summary: The address (URL) which the browser control is currently displaying. Will automatically be updated as the user navigates to another page (e.g. by clicking on a link).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsLoading
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the control is currently loading one or more web pages (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is loading; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitialized
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the WebBrowser is initialized (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is browser initialized; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitializedChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser has finished initializing

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.Title
member.summary: The title of the web page being currently displayed.
member.remarks: This property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.TitleChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser title changes

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.ZoomLevel
member.summary: The zoom level at which the browser control is currently displaying. Can be set to 0 to clear the zoom level (resets to default zoom level).

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.ZoomLevelIncrement
member.summary: Specifies the amount used to increase/decrease to ZoomLevel by By Default this value is 0.10

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CleanupElement
member.summary: The CleanupElement Controls when the BrowserResources will be cleaned up. The ChromiumWebBrowser will register on Unloaded of the provided Element and dispose all resources when that handler is called. By default the cleanup element is the Window that contains the ChromiumWebBrowser. if you want cleanup to happen earlier provide another FrameworkElement. Be aware that this Control is not usable anymore after cleanup is done.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.TooltipText
member.summary: The text that will be displayed as a ToolTip

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is disposed.
member.value: true if this instance is disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:CefSharp.Wpf.RenderingEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments to the Rendering event handler set up in IWebBrowser.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Wpf.RenderingEventArgs.#ctor(CefSharp.Wpf.Rendering.WpfBitmapInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Wpf.Rendering.BitmapFactory.CreateBitmap(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Create an instance of BitmapInfo based on the params
member.param: create bitmap info for a popup (typically just a bool flag used internally)

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key — that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.IME_CHAR
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: T:CefSharp.Wpf.Rendering.WritableBitmapInfo
member.summary: Uses WriteableBitmap to create a bitmap from the backbuffer
